Line 130: Line 130:
* {{flagicon|Israel}} [[Israel]]'s Labor Member of [[Knesset]] [[Binyamin Ben-Eliezer]] said that Israel expresses its support for Mubarak and hope the riots pass quietly.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ben-Eliezer: All we can do is express support for Mubarak |url=http://www.jpost.com/Headlines/Article.aspx?id=205362 |newspaper=Jerusalem Post |date=27 January 2011 |accessdate=27 January 2011}}</ref>
* {{flagicon|Israel}} [[Israel]]'s Labor Member of [[Knesset]] [[Binyamin Ben-Eliezer]] said that Israel expresses its support for Mubarak and hope the riots pass quietly.<ref>{{cite news |title=Ben-Eliezer: All we can do is express support for Mubarak |url=http://www.jpost.com/Headlines/Article.aspx?id=205362 |newspaper=Jerusalem Post |date=27 January 2011 |accessdate=27 January 2011}}</ref>
*{{flagicon|United Kingdom}} [[United Kingdom]]'s Foreign Secretary [[William Hague]] called on the authorities and protesters in Egypt to show restraint and avoid violence. He urged the Egyptian authorities to "listen to the concerns" of demonstrators.<ref>[http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/news/latest-news/?view=News&id=539828682 UK Foreign Secretary William Hague comment on protests in Egypt]</ref>
*{{flagicon|United Kingdom}} [[United Kingdom]]'s Foreign Secretary [[William Hague]] called on the authorities and protesters in Egypt to show restraint and avoid violence. He urged the Egyptian authorities to "listen to the concerns" of demonstrators.<ref>[http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/news/latest-news/?view=News&id=539828682 UK Foreign Secretary William Hague comment on protests in Egypt]</ref>
â
*{{flagicon|USA}} US Secretary of State [[Hillary Clinton]] said "The Egyptian government has an important opportunity to be responsive to the aspirations of the [[Egyptian people]], and pursue political, economic and social reforms that can improve their lives and help Egypt prosper."<ref name="Dan Murphy 0126" /> US Ambassador [[Margaret Scobey]] later commented: "we call on the Egyptian authorities to allow peaceful public demonstrations." <ref name="Dan Murphy 0126">{{cite news|last=Murphy|first=Dan|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Backchannels/2011/0126/The-US-response-to-Egypt-s-protests|title=The US response to Egypt's protests: 'Not much' probably sums it up best|publisher=[[The Christian Science Monitor]]|date=January 26, 2011|accessdate= January 26, 2011}}</ref> US Vice President Joseph Biden said "...weâre encouraging the government to act responsibly and â and to try to engage in a discussion as to what the legitimate claims being made are, if they are, and try to work them out.", as well as choosing not to refer Mubarak as a dictator and that he should not step down <ref name="Joe Biden">{{cite news|last=Murphy|first=Dan|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Backchannels/2011/0127/Joe-Biden-says-Egypt-s-Mubarak-no-dictator-he-shouldn-t-step-down|title=Joe Biden says Egypt's Mubarak no dictator, he shouldn't step down|publisher=The Christian Science Monitor|date=January 26, 2011|accessdate= January 28, 2011}}</ref>
+
*{{flagicon|USA}} US Secretary of State [[Hillary Clinton]] said "The Egyptian government has an important opportunity to be responsive to the aspirations of the [[Egyptian people]], and pursue political, economic and social reforms that can improve their lives and help Egypt prosper."<ref name="Dan Murphy 0126" /> US Ambassador [[Margaret Scobey]] later commented: "we call on the Egyptian authorities to allow peaceful public demonstrations." <ref name="Dan Murphy 0126">{{cite news|last=Murphy|first=Dan|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Backchannels/2011/0126/The-US-response-to-Egypt-s-protests|title=The US response to Egypt's protests: 'Not much' probably sums it up best|publisher=[[The Christian Science Monitor]]|date=January 26, 2011|accessdate= January 26, 2011}}</ref> US Vice President [[Joseph Biden]] said "...weâre encouraging the government to act responsibly and â and to try to engage in a discussion as to what the legitimate claims being made are, if they are, and try to work them out.", as well as choosing not to refer Mubarak as a dictator and that he should not step down <ref name="Joe Biden">{{cite news|last=Murphy|first=Dan|url=http://www.csmonitor.com/World/Backchannels/2011/0127/Joe-Biden-says-Egypt-s-Mubarak-no-dictator-he-shouldn-t-step-down|title=Joe Biden says Egypt's Mubarak no dictator, he shouldn't step down|publisher=The Christian Science Monitor|date=January 26, 2011|accessdate= January 28, 2011}}</ref>
